shared_text:
Atkinson Academy added 36 new photos to the album: 20200701 Kathie Dayotis' Retirement Ceremony — at Atkinson Academy.
July 2 at 10:00 AM · Atkinson, NH ·

On Wednesday, July 1, a special ceremony was held to recognize retiring Atkinson Academy principal Kathie Dayotis.

During this special event, Atkinson Lions Club presented Mrs. Dayotis with the Granite State Fellow Award and the Atkinson Selectmen presented her with a key to the Town of Atkinson. Additionally, a Scholarship Fund in Mrs. Dayotis' name was established, with initial funds surpassing $10,000! The Kathleen Dayotis Scholarship Fund will be maintained by the Atkinson Academy PTA and Night Owls.

Best wishes for your retirement, Kathie!

post_text: On Friday, February 21st, UNH Marine Docents and New England Aquarium visited Danville School to participate in the school's "Dan of the Coast" Enrichment Day event!
shared_text:
Danville School added 96 new photos to the album: 20200221 Day of the Coast Enrichment Day at Danville School — at Danville School.
February · Danville, NH ·

On February 21, 2020 Danville students learned all about oceans and how important it is to our world. The UNH Marine Docents (part of the New Hampshire Sea Grant) visited with 54 docents. The docents lead 11 different workshops and allowed students time to dig deep into learning about all things ocean. Workshops included singing sea chanteys, learning about plate tectonics, dissecting squid, understanding more about our rocky shores and so much more. A huge thank you to our PTA who funded the marine docent visit. The New England Aquarium brought along a 42 foot whale named Calvin (a model, of course) and taught our grade 1-5 students all about the importance of these huge creatures. This assembly portion of our day included 10 different hands-on stations.

Timberlane Regional High School added 121 new photos to the album: 20200131 TRHS Gatsby Gala — at Atkinson Resort & Country Club.
February 3 at 2:54 PM · Atkinson, NH ·

As a way to bring literature and history to life, students in the American Studies classes took a step back in time to experience first-hand the Roaring 20's at the 10th Annual Gatsby Gala. Decked out in their most stylish 1920's attire, students learned popular dances from the 1920's including the Charleston and Swing Dancing. In addition, a TRHS student band performed several jazz songs for the group. The day ended with some stellar performances by the American Studies students focusing in on various art forms of drama, interpretive dance, poetry, visual art and music to showcase their knowledge of the 20's and Gatsby. The day was the Bees Knees!

Grade 5 was challenged with the Drone Drop Delivery. They had to design a package that would safely allow an iPhone (raw egg) to drop 10 feet without any damage at all.

Then in the afternoon grade 5 was treated to a 2nd set of activities. One class worked on building robotic vehicles. The other grade 5 completed the Truss Bridge Challenge. The bridge that held the most weight and weighed the least won the challenge.

Timberlane Regional High School added 139 new photos to the album: 20190603 The Milkmen - 2018-19 Final Show — at Timberlane PAC.
June 13, 2019 at 10:28 AM · Plaistow, NH ·

The Milken Improv Team had an awesome time on June 3rd, performing not once, but twice! An energetic crowd filled the PAC Recital Hall to see the Season 12 team for one final time, but there was also a super-secret show that happened in the parking lot prior to the Season Finale. This super-secret show was an incentive for donations at this year’s National Improv Day! Audience members got to play five fan-favorite games right along with their favorite Milkies. Additionally, the evening show was a compilation of greatest hits ranging from physical comedy to witty word play. It was also the first time the audience got to see a sneak preview of the Season 13 team! The Milkmen cannot wait to continue riding this wave of positivity into 2019-2020!

Pollard School added 20 new photos to the album: 20190605 Surviving Camping with Mrs. Hazelton & Mrs. Rodriguez — at Pollard School.
June 5, 2019 at 3:32 PM · Plaistow, NH ·

Fifth grade teacher Mrs. Hazelton and enrichment teacher Mrs. Rodriguez worked collaboratively to provide a STEAM opportunity where students needed to use problem solving strategies and resourcefulness to complete outdoor “survival” challenges. Throughout the school day students had to decode various rebuses in order to receive their survival kit and task. Children had the opportunity to explore and problem solve with their peers and, subsequently, learn how their different personal strengths can be useful to accomplish a common goal.

Timberlane Parent Advisory Forum (TPAF)
Thursday, May 30th, 7:00-8:30p.m.
Timberlane Middle School Cafe /Annex
44 Greenough Rd, Plaistow

“Raising Resilient Children”
By Clinical Childhood Psychologist, Jenessa Deleault
Many thanks to all of you who recently completed the TPAF parent survey. We received an overwhelming response from parents requesting a TPAF session on the topics of Childhood Anxiety, Mental Health, and Strategies for Developing Resilient Children. Please join us for this year’s final TPAF event as our guest, Jenessa Deleault, hits on all of these topics in her presentation of brain-based approachesto raising resilient children. We welcome you!

If you are unable to join us in person on May 30th, the meeting will be broadcasted via Livestream at buff.ly/2FGKExc . You may send your questions to TPAF@timberlane.net while watching Livestream. Your questions will be addressed throughout the evening.

All parents of Timberlane students are invited to attend! Parents may suggest future agenda topics by emailing them to TPAF@timberlane.net
